|vendor_id = 0846 |device_id = 9055 |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = PY318300429,NDD9578221607 |icid = 4054A-18300429 |boardid = 1246-00000172-50Z |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = <!-- OUI -->
|chip1 = Realtek;RTL8812BU;RTL8812BU, I4P35P1, GI18; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |802.11ac = 867 |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->
|linuxdriv = |windriv =

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "1246-00000172-50Z", "BP4M", "E186014", "P/C=F119-223", and "EW-7822UNC" are silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
{{FCC ST|04/28/2019}}
==Links of Interest== ===USB ID (0846:9055) references=== * [https://www.centos.org/forums/viewtopic.php?t=70122 On the Centos forums] * [https://www.raspberrypi.org/forums/viewtopic.php?t=241593 On the Raspberry Pi forums]
==Notes== ===Linux support=== :For linux kernel version 2.6.24 ~ 5.8 (Realtek), 5.9 (Nov,2020) USB using the chip Realtek RTL8812BU
Easy to follow installation: https://github.com/morrownr/88x2bu
This made my usb-A6150 show up in network(Kubuntu 20.10), but remember to go to network setting and change it to wpa2. It will keep falling to connect to router, which support wpa3. The adapter itself on the other hand may not be wpa3 supported.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
